title: That ending quote with Kayle and Morg.
body:
"Why have we wings sister, if not to fly?"
"Why do we have feet if not to tread upon the soil?"

I Love it.  It shows a weird, superiority vs down to earth dynamic.

Also really excited because this is the first time we have two people operating as an aspect for one celestial aspect even if we already knew it was possible.  This will make it easier for more casual lore viewers to know it.

replies.body: And I like that it seems  ( at least from here)  the sisters don't  hate each other   or at least aren't actively trying to hurt each other. They just have different views on how to get the job done.  ANd it does bring up the question of what is true Justice and can it really be   rightfully delivered.

Nice interpretation!

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
Agreed. Solid line/dynamic between the two.

Yeah it's a shame Kayle looks so...
meh.(particularly that hair, just, why.  I was expecting sort of feminine armor.  Not bodysuit. Kai'Sa makes sense, it bonded to her flesh, Kayle is supposed to be a warrior.)

Morg looks amazing though.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sHGIBEhv,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2019-02-18T19:16:59.723+0000)
>Kai'Sa makes sense, it bonded to her flesh

I think the main issue with kai'sa's armor was how it conveniently showed cleavage instead of just her face, and the helmet is tied to her chest armor as well which is kinda odd, on top of her hair looking like she bathes it with the best shampoo in the void (but tbf, how could they make it look dirty with textures?). It just felt like design choices left for eye candy.

Kayle's armor feels incomplete, when she's unascended, it doesn't make sense to have only some parts of the body protected and when ascended its like she removes her armor to make herself more vulnerable on top of looking too generic or similar to other characters (I wouldn't be surprised if the designer was playing dawnbringer riven a lot lately and wanted to plug what he liked about that skin into the new model)

Kai'Sa likely has washed her hair.  We never saw her before she returned to the normal world.

The chest thing has plenty of logistic reasons such as allowing easier breath if she messed up and allowing more scent to bait prey.  And it's not like she travels through the void like that.
The biggest misunderstanding about Kai'sa is that she never went into the void itself. Just underground tunnels 'infected' by the void.

> [{quoted}](name=Sexy Jack Rabbit,realm=OCE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sHGIBEhv,comment-id=00010000000000000000,timestamp=2019-02-19T07:25:58.793+0000)

Yeah, and that was pretty stupid. It took someone who had the potential to do something actually legendary (going INTO the Void and surviving), and gave them the half-assed reach around that didn't really amount to anything. It's like driving all the way to Orlando, Florida, and hanging out in the parking lot of Disney World instead of actually going in.
Indeed, Kai'sa has her Helmet on when she is in the void, and whilst her helmet is on, her skin is fully covered, including her chest.

What I want to know is who taught that girl how to speak? 
I guess an 8 year old isn't exactly babbling and gooing, but living amongst mindless beasts for your entire teenage life and much of your later childhood years should not result in such verbose speech. 
Kai'Sa should not look nor sound the way she does given her desert-nomad-lost-and-alone backstory.

Despite your downvotes I agree big time. If air was the problem, she could've had some kind of gas-mask like kassadin, or some other type of filtration through a suit; and yet, we get titties. It's just really lame, pervy pandering, and now they're doing it to Kayle too.

> [{quoted}](name=CaptainMårvelous,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sHGIBEhv,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-02-18T19:13:43.071+0000)

Also Morgana is Chaotic Good now. Sorta.

> [{quoted}](name=Leadboo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sHGIBEhv,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2019-02-19T02:32:32.915+0000)
>
> Also Morgana is Chaotic Good now. Sorta.

She always was.

In a sense at least.

It wasn't portrayed that way though. If you were a lore fanatic then you'd know, but for casual players, Morgana seems like her motives are completely opposing Kayle's, their motives are virtually the same, their way of achieving those motives however, are quite different.

Literally every single one of Morgana's in-game voicelines is some variation of "I want to hurt people", and that's that.  Even if she was kind of a jerk, leaving her as JUST a jerk didn't capture it all.
Kayle's bio always said she was a zealot who went against HER OWN FEELINGS for the sake of justice; even when it felt wrong, she would kill the "bad guys", etc..  But none of that came up in game, she was just "FIGHT" and that's all her lines were, really.

There really wasn't enough fleshing them out; I've been excited for this update for YEARS.
It might sorta be the first celestial quote thingee, but remember we have Kindred, Xayah and Rakan.
Not even that, we also have Dawnbring Riven and Nightbringer Yasuo which are very celestial-esk and have oodles of interactions with eachother.

Why do the good characters almost always get turned evil in someway in league? Kayke and garen come to mind. I think it's not a healthy concept to keep enforcing. Kaylee shouldn't be representing a superiority complex, she should be representing the good form of Justice, and Morgan should be made out as evil, as she is an actual devil (fallen angel) and rebelled against good
Because "good" and "evil" are relative, and we're not trying to create those kinds of 2-dimensional tropes anymore.
Instead, you're trying to make other, completely different 2-dimensional tropes.

> [{quoted}](name=Hellioning,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sHGIBEhv,comment-id=000600020001,timestamp=2019-02-19T20:37:16.905+0000)
>
> Instead, you're trying to make other, completely different 2-dimensional tropes.

Specifically [these](https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LawfulStupid) [two](https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KnightTemplar)?

Edit:  I was discussing it with a friend and he told me something that makes a lot of sense.  What if Kayle's biggest flaw isn't that she's evil, but that she has a volatile temper?  This would further contrast the two, with Morgana being the calm defensive one and Kayle being the fiery aggressive one.
Basically, though I'd replace the first with My Country, Right or Wrong.

Okay, can you please tell me there's more lore on the way, pretty please??

The lore you guys released today make Kayle very unquestionably the evil one, and it just breaks my heart to see my girl portrayed like that. I think one of the things that bothers me is that not only does Kayle never act reasonably in their bios but also Morgana doesn't do a single even remotely bad thing in either PoV. If there's to be balance between their ideals, (which I think there should), both sisters have to have solid redeeming qualities *and* fuck up hard somewhere, but Kayle got the short end of the stick.

Morgana dresses angsty and hides her wings :)

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sHGIBEhv,comment-id=00060002,timestamp=2019-02-19T19:59:54.984+0000)
>
> Because "good" and "evil" are relative, and we're not trying to create those kinds of 2-dimensional tropes anymore.



So instead of having Kayle be a character who sacrificed for her people, even her own individuality, in an attempt to keep her people safe resulting in her becoming at war with her sister, you instead have her be a 2 dimensional zealous nut case who seeks to purges an entire village because they got pissed a guy was killed.

Oh and Morgana goes from being a character who rejects safety if it comes at the expense of individuality and freedom, even if she pursues it via dark means, to being a compassionate misunderstood reformer.

Congrats in your attempt to "not create 2-dimensional tropes" you removed all substance from these two and made them 2-dimensional tropes.  Take a bow.  It is truly rare to see someone literally pull off the exact opposite of what they set out to do.  It would be like Michelangelo setting out to pain the Sistine Chapel and instead stripping it down to the bare stone.

Personally I love the idea of them both being morally grey characters, I always felt they were in the first place.

But please don't entirely shy away from pure good or pure evil characters, they're too fun to just never use again. :)

(Also love the movement speed boost when tethered, that's an ability I've been putting on my fan concepts for a while!)

I mean sure, sometimes good and evil can be relative, but there is also just good and evil, like those are terms for a reason. It's pretty universally agreed that Hitler was evil, sure the man might have had some redeeming features somewhere but none of that mattered when compared to the atrocities which he committed which have led to him being known as unequivocally evil. Similarly whereas I'm sure to be the first to tell you that no man is perfect Fred Rogers was as far as we know about as close as they come, and as such anyone you ask will tell you he is good. Honestly I think people shy away from writing such characters after a point because it can be difficult to present them in a way that doesn't seem flat, but honestly that's on the writers.
She isn't evil, she just disagreed with Kayle and co.
Kayle has always been well intentioned extremist.
I'm having trouble seeing Morgana's "justice" though.  She seems more redemption then justice.  There's something I'm not able to put my finger on and it bugs me.

> Also really excited because this is the first time we have two people operating as an aspect for one celestial aspect even if we already knew it was possible.

Oh? Where was it mentioned before?

My understanding of the blurb on the main page is that they ARE NOT the hosts, but actually beings born from the Celestial Aspect itself (I really fucking hate Riot for naming the god being and their worldly avatar the exact same title, it's so convoluted to discuss). So I think they're more on par with Bard or Soraka more than anything, and above the power level of like Taric, Diana, and Zoe.

> superiority vs down to earth

Very literally
Evil has always been the more pragmatic alignment.
